ygData.subject: Re: Song Taunting.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Actually, I think this is exactly how it works.  With the (rare) exception of the single-target songs, everything we sing is AE.  This includes not just
ygData.messageBody:
"Kimes, Dean W." wrote:

> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Speaking of Song taunting...
> Only thing I can figure is that somehow the code is messed up to the point
> that when a song pulses, the mobs consider it cast on everything within its
> radius, whether it has an effect or not.
>
> Kitasi
>

Actually, I think this is exactly how it works. With the (rare) exception of the single-target songs,
everything we sing is AE. This includes not just the AE damage songs, but all party buff songs as well.
If a MOB is within the radius, they will notice. This is why, when fighting in, say, Cazic, you will get
a pile of lizards beating on you: 1) they wander towards the party, 2) they enter your area of effect, 3)
unless someone did something to explicitly tick them off, you are now the target.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 35 songs, Innoruuk
